intro: Cerastium pisidicum, commonly known as the Lesser Mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, commonly known as the carnation family. The plant features small, hairy leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers that bloom in early summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Cerastium pisidicum is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local insect populations.
